intro: Sindoropsis, commonly known as the yellow mangrove, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and ability to thrive in brackish water environments. The plant features broad, glossy leaves and produces clusters of yellowish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its root system is adapted to tolerate saline conditions, making it an important species in coastal ecosystems. Sindoropsis is also valued for its timber and has traditional uses in local communities.
